entries.title: US Attorney General calls for end to cocaine sentencing disparity
entries.description: Memos from the head of US justice department take aim at drug policies linked to high rates of Black incarceration.

entries.title: US ‘botched’ executions reach all-time high, report finds
entries.description: Seven of 20 attempted executions in 2022 were 'visibly problematic', research group says, but practice is in decline.

entries.title: ‘The forgotten ones’: Rural supporters stand by Peru’s Castillo
entries.description: Pedro Castillo's removal hit a nerve in rural heartland, where ex-president's message resonated amid years of exclusion.

entries.title: QAnon supporter gets five years for January 6 Capitol attack
entries.description: US construction worker accused of 'weaponising' Trump supporters during the January 6 riot faces rebuke from judge.

entries.title: Two UN peacekeepers shot dead near Timbuktu in Mali
entries.description: UN peacekeeping mission says four others were wounded in the attack carried out by an unidentified gunman on Friday.

entries.title: Ukraine energy firm ends state of emergency after Russia attacks
entries.description: Ukrainian energy use dropped more than 50 percent after the Russian attacks, power grid operator Ukrenergo said.

entries.title: Qatar 2022: Best on-field highlights from the World Cup
entries.description: As the World Cup reaches its finale on Sunday, here's how Al Jazeera photographers captured the tournament.

entries.title: Renowned Mexican journalist survives shooting
entries.description: Ciro Gomez Leyva says he was saved by his armoured vehicle after gunmen shot at him near his home in Mexico City.

entries.title: Twitter’s suspension of journalists draws global backlash
entries.description: Officials from France, Germany, UK, UN and EU condemned the suspensions, saying it jeopardised press freedom.

entries.title: What’s next for the ANC and South African politics?
entries.description: South Africa's governing party conference comes at a time President Cyril Ramaphosa is mired in a corruption scandal.

entries.title: US lawmakers quick to unload FTX founder’s contributions
entries.description: Legislators are donating contributions from the disgraced crypto mogul but could still be on the hook for the money.

entries.title: Argentina fans upset by lack of World Cup finals tickets
entries.description: Hundreds are angry at the lack of ticket availability and high black-market prices for the finals against France.

entries.title: FIFA chief praises Qatar 2022 as ‘best World Cup ever’
entries.description: Infantino hails 'transformative legacy' of event and spread of nations in knockout stage - with a nod also to Morocco.

entries.title: California county considers secession to become new US state
entries.description: San Bernandino County is set to review the long-shot proposal in response to voter frustration with state lawmakers.

entries.title: Jordanians continue fuel protests day after ‘rioting’
entries.description: Calls for protests come a day after riots, staged mainly by angry truck drivers in Maan, left one police officer dead.

entries.title: Timeline: Peru’s political crisis since removal of Pedro Castillo
entries.description: Protesters are demanding Castillo's release, dissolution of Congress and early elections in the South American nation.

entries.title: Pakistan summons Afghan diplomat over border shelling
entries.description: Border tensions between the South Asian neighbours have risen since the Taliban returned to power last year.

entries.title: Brittney Griner says she will return to playing basketball
entries.description: In first remarks since returning to the US, WNBA star thanks all who pushed for her release from Russian prison.

entries.title: US to launch new diplomatic approach to China with ‘China House’
entries.description: The new unit in the US Department of State aims to create 'more consistent policy' towards China, a rival global power.

entries.title: Harvard appoints Claudine Gay as first Black president
entries.description: Social scientist and daughter of Haitian immigrants says the university must 'engage and be of service to the world'.

entries.title: US-France satellite to map world’s oceans, rivers, lakes
entries.description: The satellite will help track the impacts of rising sea levels, droughts and erosion brought on by climate change.

entries.title: Burkina Faso summons Ghana envoy over president’s claim on Wagner
entries.description: President Nana Akufo-Addo alleged during the US-Africa Leaders Summit that Burkina Faso has hired Russian mercenaries.

entries.title: Kosovo tribunal convicts ex-rebel leader for war crimes
entries.description: A Kosovo court seated in the Netherlands sentences Salih Mustafa to 26 years in prison in its first war crimes verdict.

entries.title: World Cup mural gig helps Doha artist turn hobby into lifeline
entries.description: Filipino painter Michael Conjusta was hired by Qatari authorities to paint graffiti murals during the 2022 World Cup.

entries.title: Huge aquarium in Berlin bursts, causing tropical fish ‘tsunami’
entries.description: The incident at the AquaDom tourist attraction - the world's biggest cylindrical tank - injures at least two people.

entries.title: Opposition hopes democratic ideals can return in Tunisia
entries.description: As overseas voting begins, voter apathy is palpable and begs the question if the spirit of democracy in Tunisia is dead.

entries.title: Mail bomb wounds Russian official in CAR – Russian news agency
entries.description: The founder of the Russian private military company Wagner has accused France of being behind the bomb.

entries.title: Visualising the FIFA World Cup final
entries.description: Over the World Cup's 92-year history, 13 nations have made it to the finals, with eight being crowned champions.

entries.title: Russia ‘massively’ attacks Ukraine in latest round of raids
entries.description: Russia launches 60 missiles on least four cities in new attack on Ukraine's infrastructure with casualties reported.

entries.title: Protesters block Kashmir highway after two shot dead at army camp
entries.description: Hundreds protest at the region's main highway over killing of two men who worked as labourers at an Indian army base.

entries.title: Europe’s prosecution of Liberian war criminals is good news
entries.description: But meaningful justice and reconciliation cannot be achieved until Liberia starts conducting its own war crimes trials.

entries.title: Senegalese MPs detained for assaulting pregnant lawmaker
entries.description: The fight has worsened political tensions in Senegal that flared since the ruling party lost its comfortable majority.

entries.title: Ukraine must investigate alleged war crimes by its forces
entries.description: Ukraine and its allies should understand that investigating such allegations is in Kyiv’s interest.

entries.title: India, Pakistan foreign ministers trade heated barbs on ‘terror’
entries.description: Pakistani minister calls India's Modi 'butcher of Gujarat' after Jaishankar said Pakistan is 'epicentre of terrorism'.

entries.title: S Africa ex-President Zuma sues Ramaphosa ahead of key party vote
entries.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa rejects the private prosecution, says Zuma is abusing legal processes.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 296
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 296th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: More than 13,000 new JFK files released; hundreds more held back
entries.description: Record release not expected to give major revelations about the assassination of US President John F Kennedy in 1963.

entries.title: Italy slams ECB for hiking borrowing costs as recession looms
entries.description: The criticism comes after the European Central Bank raised interest rates by half a percentage point.

entries.title: Pacifist Japan unveils unprecedented $320bn military build-up
entries.description: Unthinkable under past administrations, the rapid arming of Japan has the support of about 70 percent of voters.

entries.title: Fara Williams: England’s once-homeless football pioneer
entries.description: By day, Williams was playing for England. By night, she was sleeping in hostels.

entries.title: Can Somalia overcome its history of crises?
entries.description: President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud joins Marc Lamont Hill to discuss his country’s security and humanitarian challenges.

entries.title: Five children among at least 10 killed in fire near France’s Lyon
entries.description: Footage on social media shows a huge, dark cloud billowing above a residential building in Vaulx-en-Velin.

entries.title: Libya PM admits role in Lockerbie suspect’s transfer
entries.description: The transfer of a former intelligence explosives expert to the US has prompted anger in Libya.

entries.title: Police officer killed in Jordan as anger over fuel prices spreads
entries.description: Clashes broke out between police and locals in several Jordanian cities, including Maan, where the officer was killed.

entries.title: China calls for ‘arduous efforts’ to revive economy
entries.description: State planner's comments come after the release of worse-than-expected economic data for November.

entries.title: Car bomb in Turkey’s Diyarbakir injures police officers
entries.description: Two people believed to be behind the blast have been detained, authorities have said.

entries.title: Twitter suspends journalists covering Elon Musk
entries.description: Twitter owner accuses journalists of endangering his family as press groups condemn suspensions.

entries.title: The US is making Africa’s hunger worse
entries.description: The pandemic and the war show the need for strong local food supply chains to avoid disruptions. Yet the US won't learn.

entries.title: Why Indians love World Cup football, even without India in it
entries.description: In a country that has never played at the World Cup, passion for the sport comes alive during the event.

entries.title: Peru judge extends ex-President Castillo’s jail time by 18 months
entries.description: Pedro Castillo's arrest on charges of 'rebellion' and 'conspiracy' has fuelled a political crisis.

entries.title: Apple looks beyond ‘iPhone factory’ China as dalliance sours
entries.description: Tech giant is seeking to redirect supply chains to India and Vietnam amid fears of overdependence on China.

entries.title: Two dead, dozens missing after landslide hits Malaysian campsite
entries.description: The site north of the Malaysian capital was hit in the early hours of morning after torrential rain.

entries.title: North Korea says it tested ‘high-thrust solid-fuel motor’
entries.description: Pyongyang wants to build more solid-fuel missiles, which are more stable and can be launched with almost no warning.

entries.title: ‘I want to go outside’: First Nauru refugees finally find freedom
entries.description: Six men held for years after trying to get to Australia by boat look forward to starting new lives in New Zealand.
